intro: Cryptantha celosioides, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a compact, mat-forming growth habit with hairy stems and leaves. Cryptantha celosioides is adapted to survive in harsh conditions with deep root systems and drought tolerance.
